intro: Galium hierochuntinum, commonly known as the Hierocuntine bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in clusters. It blooms from late spring to early summer, and its fruits are small, dry capsules containing numerous tiny seeds. Galium hierochuntinum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
